description.narrative: MAP is an organization to promote and protect migrant’s rights in Thailand. Migrants in Thailand are generally vulnerable to labor exploitation. Thailand migration policies undermined of labor laws while labor law and rights protection are limitation to apply all workers. Project of Promoting Migrant Worker’s Right is target to migrant workers from Myanmar. In this 5 years, MAP intends to build linkages and develop capacity of migrant workers in Thailand and civil society organizations in Myanmar to promote safe migration and rights protections, with a special focus on women’s rights and empowerment.  To accomplish its goals, project will work through five main programs and its administrative support unit and the expected results are: 1) Labour Rights for All (LRA) - Migrant workers are able to receive labour rights protections equal to Thai workers without discrimination and access recourse mechanisms 2) Rights for All (RFA) Migrant women, children, youth, and migrants in crisis have knowledge & capacity on how to receive their rights and access health, education and legal status services 3) Community Health and Empowerment (CHE)  Migrant workers of all occupations and documentation status are able to prevent and treat HIV, TB and other infectious diseases according to their health rights without discrimination  4) MAP MultiMedia (MMM) – To increase migrants’ access to up to date and accurate information on their rights and news in migrants’ languages through various media channels 5) Administrative Support Unit (ASU) To strengthen the functioning and quality of MAP programming through good governance and capacity building. Main activities consist, education and awareness, advocacy, network, campaign, community outreach and mobilization and cross border safe migration. The thematic areas Migrant’s Rights regarding: Labor Rights, Health Rights, Women’s Rights, Right to Education. Other stakeholder including Local government agencies, CBOs, NGOs and Private sectors.
This project mainly contributes to results within Empowerment of human rights defenders. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
